subject: Kachin conflict
object: First conflict: 5 February 1961 - 24 February 1994, Second conflict: 9 June 2011 - present

subject: Kachin conflict
object: Kachin State and northern Shan State

subject: Kachin conflict
object: Ongoing, Ceasefire signed between the government of Myanmar and the Kachin Independence Army in 1994, Resumption of hostilities in 2011 after the 17-year ceasefire is broken

subject: Belligerents
object: Union of Burma, Socialist Republic of the Union of Burma, Union of Myanmar, Republic of the Union of Myanmar, Kachin Independence Organisation, Arakan Army, All Burma Students' Democratic Front, National Unity Government, Communist Party of Burma, New Democratic Army - Kachin

subject: Commanders and leaders
object: Myint Swe, Min Aung Hlaing, Soe Win, Mya Tun Oo, Win Maung, Ne Win, San Yu, Saw Maung, Than Shwe, Wai Lwin, Thein Sein, Sein Win, Htin Kyaw, Aung San Suu Kyi, Win Myint, N'Ban La, Htang Gam Shawng, Twan Mrat Naing, Zaw Seng, Zaw Tu, Zaw Dan

subject: Units involved
object: Tatmadaw, Myanmar Army, 33rd Light Infantry Division, Myanmar Air Force, Kachin Independence Army, People's Defence Force, other civilian militias
